instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
Hi, i have this board no liquid spill, i have <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 1,2V, in diode mode 0,447 (bad), i try to change <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> but same problem. 
i don't understand where the <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is generated, by <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
Why do you think 447 is bad?
Doesn't look low at all.

Do you get <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> and correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Check <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> disconnecting trackpad flex.
If still bad, change <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.
As last step, change <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> if needed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
PPBUS=8,59V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>=3,41
sorry i say bad for 1,2V  i have just the board with magsafe board and cable flex. 
i remove <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> same problem, i change again <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and i come back

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
Same with another <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 1,2V
i try to remove <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and L4820 but no change

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
I hope you didn't power up the board without <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>!!!

Remove <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7410</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C4810</CAPACITOR> and check again <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
i power up the board without <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, is it dangerous? because i haven't <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>. i dead the board?
I remove <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7400</CAPACITOR> instead of <CAPACITOR>C7410</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C4810</CAPACITOR>, same 1,2V on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
CPU could be fried now.
Post diode mode to ground at L7430.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
Doesn't look bad, you could be lucky.

Check diode mode on all 3V3 and 5V power rails; from S5 to S0.
Check all traces, solders and components around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
I check all rail 3V3 and 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>=0,465
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>=0,412
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=0,564
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>=0,381
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>=0,465
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>=0,341
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW</SIGNAL>=0,486
i check trace nothing, solder and component around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> seems good, i compare with another board.
Maybe i use bad <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> from donor board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
"22=4,57"
Are you really sure?
If yes, change <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.
There is 3.3V LDO output...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green led but not start
threads.message:
ok thanks, i solve the problem, i think i remove by mistake <CAPACITOR>C7503</CAPACITOR>, when i change <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> the first time.
Now the mac work well.
